definition: to renege/to go back (on a deal)/to back out (of a promise)
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
to regret
to vow not to break one's promise

sentences.english: To refuse baptism and to retract after baptism were crimes punishable by death.
sentences.chinese: 凡拒絕受洗和受洗後反悔的都以死刑論罪。

sentences.english: She quickly regretted the decision and locked him out of their honeymoon suite.
sentences.chinese: 隨後，簡很快反悔，並把自己鎖在了蜜月套房裏頭。

sentences.english: One day the president said yes, the next no.
sentences.chinese: 總統經常第一天說好，第二天又反悔。

sentences.english: An attempt was made to eradicate, but the pope reversed himself.
sentences.chinese: 只是試圖根除，但教皇反悔了他的話。

sentences.english: Our tradition does not allow a change of vote, once cast, except abstentions .
sentences.chinese: 我們的傳統不充許投票反悔，一旦投了，只能接受。

sentences.english: Unless you wanna go back on the deal we made.
sentences.chinese: 除非你想反悔我們的協議。

sentences.english: The second question is usually the source of feedback fear.
sentences.chinese: 第二個問題通常是反悔恐懼的來源。

sentences.english: When a hunting sparrowhawk 'locks on' to a target there is no turning back.
sentences.chinese: 當雀鷹‘鎖定’一個目標後，它從來沒有反悔過。

sentences.english: Once you have made a promise, there is no turning back.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你做出了承諾，就不能反悔了。

sentences.english: They regarded the request for delay as merely the prelude to his recantation .
sentences.chinese: 也認爲他延期的請求就是他反悔的先聲。

sentences.english: And when our transition into eternity begins, there won't be a chance for any do-overs.
sentences.chinese: 而當我們跨入永恆，將再也沒有反悔的機會。

definition: old: to reap the consequences of one's words (idiom, from Mencius); modern: to go back on one's word/to blow hot and cold/to contradict oneself/inconsistent
lit. to eat one's words/to break a promise/to go back on one's word/to renege/unsworn testimony
to break a promise/breach of contract
to change one's mind/to go back on one's word
to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
to promise/to consent (to do sth)
to renege on a debt
to have a prior engagement
to keep one's promise/to mean what one says
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
to break a promise of marriage
to shrink back as the time for battle approaches (idiom)/to get cold feet
written pledge/contract/IOU
promise/pledge
to do as promised/to be as good as one's word/to honor one's word/to mean what one says
down payment/advance payment
